metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12735 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
getchar.c in Vim before 8.1.1365 and Neovim before 0.3.6 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary OS commands via the :source! command in amodeline, as demonstrated by execute in Vim, and assert_fails or nvim_inputin Neovim.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.3').
